titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Arundell Family, Letters and Documents
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 30, 2019 at 03:02

did.unittitle: [Letters and documents concerning various members of the Arundell family].

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Manuscripts, in multiple hands, of ten business letters and legal documents concerning members of the Arundel family. The collection incldues two bonds of payment; several money orders; and two letters from R. Arundel to Sir Robert Clayton, drawing Clayton's attention to a "young lady of a considerable fortune," asking for Clayton's assistance in marriage-making for Arundel's son, and explaining what he would be willing to settle upon the couple.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn fb42 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Arundell Family, Letters and Documents. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a complete inventory of the contents of Osborn fb42. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

controlaccess.subject: Legal documents
Marriage -- Great Britain
Nobility -- Great Britain
controlaccess.geogname: Great Britain -- Social life and customs -- 17th century

did.unittitle: Letters patent (copy) to Thomas Howard, Earl of Arundel and Surrey (1586-1646) for holding the Court of the Constable and Marshal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.; 26 x 19 cm.
Endorsed: "Coppy of the Lettrs.
patent to Thomas Earl of Arundell for
holding the Court of the Constable
and Marshal 20 Jabs. 1 aug."
James I, King of Great Britain,
1566-1625; Great Britain. Earl
Marshal. Great Britain.
Court of Constable and Marshall.

did.unittitle: ARUNDELL OF TRERICE, RICHARD ARUNDELL, BARON, D. 1687

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Signed and sealed bond by Arundell
and Richard Scawen on a printed form,
promising to pay £200 to Edward
Hinton, goldsmith of London.
1 p.; 30 x 19 cm.
Witnessed by Claudius Pettit and
George Bucknor, with their
signatures.

did.unittitle: ARUNDELL OF WARDOUR, THOMAS ARUNDELL, BARON, 1633-1712

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
concerning payment to William Staley
(Stayley) (d. 1678).
1 p., torn; 16 x 21 cm.
"Mr Clayton I desire you will pay
unto this bearer Mr Stayley the summ
of three hundred pound."

did.unittitle: ARUNDELL OF WARDOUR, THOMAS ARUNDELL, BARON, 1633-1712

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
requesting payment to Sir Thomas
Bond. Endorsed with receipt, signed
and in the hand of Bond, 1665 May 9.
1 p.; 21 x 15 cm.

did.unittitle: ARUNDELL OF WARDOUR, THOMAS ARUNDELL, BARON, 1633-1712

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
requesting payment. Endorsed with
receipt, signed and in the hand of
George Messenger, 1665 May 17.
1 p.; 18 x 15 cm.

did.unittitle: ARUNDELL OF TRERICE, RICHARD ARUNDELL, BARON, D. 1687

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Trerice.
Proposes to Clayton that his son
marry "a young Lady, of a
Considerable Fortune, in wch. you
are Concern'd."
1 p.; 26 x 18 cm.

did.unittitle: ARUNDELL OF TRERICE, RICHARD ARUNDELL, BARON, D. 1687

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Trerice.
Concerns the proposed marriage of
his son, discussed in his letter to
Clayton of 1671 Oct 2. "Sr. Your
Civill, and friendly Letter, I have
receiv'd."
1 p.; 29 x 21 cm.

did.unittitle: ARUNDELL OF WARDOUR, THOMAS ARUNDELL, BARON, 1633-1712

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
Concerns the deed of a mortgage.
Mentions a Mr. Bennet and Sir Walter
Long.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Signed Arundell.
Acknowledges receipt of £500 from
Richard Franklyn and John Wyse.
1 p.; 31 x 19 cm.
Witnessed by Matthew Scott, Peter
Clayton, and Sir Anthony Keck
(1630-95), with their signatures.
Henry Howard, son and heir apparent
to the duke of Norfolk, was styled
Earl of Arundel 1677-84, and Baron
Mowbray, 1679.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Signed Arundell.
Promises to pay £10,600 to Richard
Franklyn and John Wyse.
1 p.; 36 x 23 cm.
Witnessed by Francis Negus (d. 1732),
Sir Anthony Keck (1630-95), and
Friamor (?) Baldwin, with their
signatures.
Henry Howard, son and heir apparent
to the duke of Norfolk, was styled
Earl of Arundel 1677-84, and Baron
Mowbray, 1679.
